title: ryx
text: package contain following functions ryx, print, plot, summary. ryx function create table correlation given y variable vector x variables data frame. Since return value class “ryx”, print, plot, summary functions included work appropriately returned value.

title: ryx
text: Create correlation table function class “ryx”
code: Library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv", x = c("age","dis","lstat"))

title: ryx
text: function print correlation table without rownames

title: ryx
text: function show customized summary data. Click summary details -depth info

title: ryx
text: function print ggplot variables v. absolute values correlation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Phearom Duong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Duong P (2022). ryx: Print Table Correlation Dependent Independent Variables. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ryx: Print Table of Correlation between Dependent and Independent Variables},   author = {Phearom Duong},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Print Table of Correlation between Dependent and Independent Variables
title: Print Table of Correlation between Dependent and Independent Variables
text: goal ryx create correlation table dependent variable y vector independent variables x return correlation table class ryx. Additionally, specific print.ryx, plot.ryx, summary.ryx class ryx table.

title: Print Table of Correlation between Dependent and Independent Variables
text: can install development version ryx like :

title: Print Table of Correlation between Dependent and Independent Variables
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ryx) library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv", x = c("age", "dis", "lstat"))  print(x) summary(x) plot(x)

what: Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
title: Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
text: Given object class 'ryx', plot function return ggplot showing absolute correlation values variables object.

title: Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
text: x object 'ryx' class

title: Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
text: plot x-axis absolute correlation values y-axis variables.

title: Plot of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — plot.ryx
code: if (FALSE) { #import MASS package for example data library(MASS)  #create an 'ryx' class object x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")  #plot the 'ryx' class object plotR <- plot(x) }

what: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
title: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
text: Given object class 'ryx', print function print table column names "variable", "r", "p", "sigif". table also excludes rownames.

title: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
code: # S3 method for ryx print(x, digits = 3)

title: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
text: x object 'ryx' class digits Rounding digits values, default value 3

title: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
text: printing correlation table

title: Print of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — print.ryx
code: if (FALSE) { #import MASS package for example data library(MASS)  #create an 'ryx' class object x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")  #print the 'ryx' class object printR <- print(x) }

title: Correlation Table of class 'ryx' — ryx
text: Given dataframe, y variable, vector x variables, ryx function return list variable y, vector variables x, dataframe correlation, p-value, stars rating p-value.

title: Correlation Table of class 'ryx' — ryx
Correlation Table of class 'ryx' — ryx
text: data dataframe y variable x vector variables create correlation table, NULL, return correlation table variables excluding y

title: Correlation Table of class 'ryx' — ryx
text: plot x-axis absolute correlation values y-axis variables.

title: Correlation Table of class 'ryx' — ryx
code: if (FALSE) { #import MASS package for example data library(MASS)  #create an 'ryx' class object x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")  }

what: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
title: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
text: Given object class 'ryx', summary function print description 'ryx' object class. description includes variables compared , median absolute correlation value, range correlation values, amount variables p values less 0.05.

title: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
code: # S3 method for ryx summary(x, digits = 3)

title: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
text: x object 'ryx' class digits Digits rounding values, Default value 3

title: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
text: summary statement median correlation value, range correlation values, amount variables p-value < 0.05

title: Summary of Correlation for Object Class 'ryx' — summary.ryx
code: if (FALSE) { #import MASS package for example data library(MASS)  #create an 'ryx' class object x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")  #summary of the 'ryx' class object summaryR <- summary(x) }
